title: Backgammon
summary: Backgammon is a tables game and one of a family of games whose history can be traced back nearly 5,000 years to archaeological discoveries in Jiroft, modern-day Iran.[2][3][4][5] Its immediate ancestor was the 16th-century game of Irish, the Anglo-Scottish equivalent of the  French Toutes Tables and Spanish Todas Tablas,[6] the latter being recorded by Alfonso X in his 1283 work, El Libro de los Juegos.
